description.narrative: Insatsen innefattar finansiellt stöd för fem (5) FN-experter till UNDP under en 12-månaders period. Experterna ska arbeta som regionala samordnare i valprocessen i DR Kongo. De ingår som en del i ett större program som hanteras av UNDP för valstöd, Projet d'Appui au Cycle Electoral au Congo 2015-2017 (PACEC). Experterna kommer att vara placerade i fem olika provinser och utgör en del av ett team på hittills åtta experter. De ska bidra till koordinering och förbättrat genomförande av den pågående uppdateringen av valröstlängden, samt övervaka att såväl denna uppdatering som ett kommande val genomförs på rimligt sätt. De ska arbeta nära den nationella valkommissionen (CENI), vilka även är den främsta samarbetspartnern för UNDP under PACEC programmet.

The contribution entails support to regional election coordination in DRC during May 2017-April 2018 via UNDPs program - PACEC (Projet d'Appui au Cycle Electoral au Congo 2015-2017). The support will be present in 5 different provinces and is part of a larger regional election coordination support. It shall contribute to improved coordination and the carrying out of the up-dating of the voters registration, and contribute to that the registration is carried out in a reasonable manner. The contribution will also support the election process, once such is initiated. The projekct will closely relate to the national election Commission (CENI), who is also the main beneficiary of the UNDP/PACEC program.
The main objective of the secondment is to support the government of DRC in organising transparent and peaceful election and pacific transfer of power via election.

Aid Targeting the Objectives of the Framework Convention on Climate Change - Adaptation

Reproductive, Maternal, Newborn and Child Health (RMNCH)

description.narrative: Due to the support of the project the following results was achieved: - The Independent National Electoral Commission (CENI) registered more than 53% of the DRC population to participate in the elections process. The centralized data collected by the CENI show 42,438,107 enlisted voters throughout the country, with 47% women versus 53% men. - Training of 171 IT Suppers central server antennas of the CENI in 26 provinces. The antennas where covered by the data remote system were able to transmit their data via these infrastructures. - Technical support to the CENI were for the configuration and implementation of the servers installed in Kinshasa and 26 Provinces. These servers needed a strengthening data security system to reduce the risk of data loss at the antennas. In addition, the UNDP/PACEC managed to assist CENI in data centralization at the central level (CENI Headquarter). The infrastructure has been strengthened in order to increase capacity of the electoral file database. The data algorithms have been reviewed and improved, increased the daily insertion of voter’s database. During the implementation stage, the UNDP/PACEC experts, were shifted in the Secretary Executive of Provincial (SEP)/CENI in 5 respective assigned provinces of Kasai central, Kwilu, Equateur, Kongo central and Mayindombe, actively participated in the National Training of Trainers (FEN), Provincial Trainers (FEP), Territorial Trainers (FET) and it members. Registration Centers (MCI). The UNDP/PACEC secondment support consisted in advising the SEP on the material organization of the voter registration process, including trainings and advocacy. The feedback upon rising numbers of women famers encountered difficulties in the implementation of these activities. To mitigate these, The UNDP/PACEC staff advocated for the Day of Sunday to be dedicated only for the women. Another challenge resolved by the project were the delayed in the deployment of training kits, security incidents, difficulties in time and help in a consequent decision made thus ensured the success of the project results. The recruited of 3379 CENI staff was done based on the forecasts of the CENI. Unfortunately, CENI failed to recruit 30% of women has Article 13 of CENI required to meet gender equity. The internal reasons of the CENI, lead these figures and these were modified during the implementation of the activities. Therefore; it led to an achieved rate of 80% of CENI staff to register 52% of population registered as voters to participate in the coming elections.
No indicator available - only a description of the activity results is published
